alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Ector; Martin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 4:04PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ector, southeastern Andrews, northwestern Midland and west central Martin Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 404 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northwest of Midland International Air and Space Port, or 16 miles southeast of Andrews, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Ector, southeastern Andrews, northwestern Midland and west central Martin Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
